other_tests.findings: Delayed F waves in the upper limbs and motor and sensory conduction abnormalities in lower limbs with no conduction block, suggestive of a distal axonal neuropathy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Sensory and motor lower limb responses were absent on nerve conduction studies 3 months later, confirming definite progression.

other_tests.findings: Raised CSF protein at 2.76 g/L with normal glucose and cell counts suggested an inflammatory process at the level of the nerve root.
Reduced free testosterone of 146 pmol/L and an abnormal cortisol response to a short Synacthen test (200 nmol/L, normal >450) suggesting adrenal insufficiency.
Showed a monotonous population of plasma cells with CD38-positive and lambda-positive cells on immunocytochemistry, confirming a solitary T7 plasmacytoma.
